pillars.title: Reason to Begin
pillars.description: Why Are We in Business Together? - Purpose & Values

questions.text: What was the original heartbeat behind this business? Why did we start—or why are we still here?
questions.description: Reflect on the founding vision and what continues to drive your family business forward.

questions.text: If your children or grandchildren asked, "Why does our family own this business?"—what would you say?
questions.description: Think about how you would explain the deeper meaning of your business to the next generation.

questions.text: What values must we never compromise, even when things get tough?
questions.description: Identify the core principles that define who you are as a family business.

questions.text: Do I want us to keep this business for generations, or prepare to sell one day? Why?
questions.description: Consider your long-term vision for the business and what success looks like for your family.

questions.text: What kind of role do I want—operator, owner, investor, supporter?
questions.description: Think about your ideal involvement level and how it may evolve over time.

questions.text: Who should be allowed to own shares—and who shouldn't? Where do I draw the line, and why?
questions.description: Define clear boundaries about ownership participation and the reasoning behind them.

pillars.title: Expectations
pillars.description: The Three Circles & Beyond - Roles & Responsibility

questions.text: Where do I sit today—Family, Business, Ownership? Am I clear about that?
questions.description: Map your current position across the three circles of family business and assess your clarity.

questions.text: Do I believe we have a clear succession plan—or are we hoping things just work out?
questions.description: Honestly evaluate your current succession planning and identify gaps that need attention.

questions.text: What do I expect from other family members—and what do I think they expect of me?
questions.description: Examine mutual expectations and potential misalignments within the family.

pillars.title: Extinction
pillars.description: What Could Go Wrong? - Risk & Resilience

questions.text: What's the biggest threat to our family staying united in business?
questions.description: Identify the most significant risks that could divide your family or damage the business.

questions.text: Where are we strong—and where are we vulnerable—when it comes to people, money, skills, and relationships?
questions.description: Conduct an honest assessment of your family business's strengths and weaknesses.

questions.text: Who makes the tough calls in our family business today? Is that clear—and is it working?
questions.description: Evaluate your current decision-making structure and its effectiveness.
